answers.answer: Hello,The symptoms which you have described are classically described as “Glove & Stocking neuropathy” in medical science and it can result from different underlying pathologies like diabetes mellitus. I hope you got her blood sugar checked. Vitamin deficiencies like deficiencies of Vitamin B1, B6 and B12 can result in similar symptoms.Some of the other causes are neurological causes, thyroid disorders, SLE, Sjogren’s syndrome, adrenal gland insufficiency, multiple sclerosis, motor neuron disease, hypothalamus dysfunction and Raynaud’s disease.I sincerely advise you to discuss these possibilities with your doctor.I hope it helps. Take care and please do keep us posted on how you are doing.

question: My teenage daughter has had a headache for a week. Today she's pain free but her hands, feet and face feel numb and are very pale. She also has tremors in her fingers and complains that she's "shaking" inside and her heart beats funny.
title: Numbness in hands, face and feet.
